ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The people of the Thicket* were also wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The dwellers of the Wood (near Midian) were also wicked.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And the people of Aykah were also wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Since the People of the Forest were unjust,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And indeed the Dwellers of the Woods were unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And the Dwellers of Al-Aykah, were also wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the dwellers of the thicket also were most surely unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Certainly the dwellers in the Thicket were evildoers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And the dwellers in the wood indeed were evil-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The people of the Wood were also surely wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And the dwellers of the wood surely were wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed the inhabitants of Aykah were [also] wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And the Companions of the Wood were also wrong-doers;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And the dwellers in the wood [i.e. the people of Madyan (Midian) to whom Prophet Shu'aib was sent by Allah), were also Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The dwellers of the Thicket were harmdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The people of the Woods were also wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And the companions of the thicket were [also] wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [15:78] And certainly (in has been softened, in other words [understand it as being] innahu) the dwellers in the wood, a huddle of trees near Midian — these were the people of [the prophet] Shu‘ayb — were evildoers, for denying Shu‘ayb.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And the dwellers in the wood) i.e. the people of Shu'ayb (indeed were evil-doers) idolaters.
